text:
<@U01MM4EAC69> Stop thinking about individual pages and consider your site as a whole.

I would suggest creating supporting pages that address topics for which those powerful pages rank. Specifically topics where it wouldn’t fit well to update the existing page and yet your rank is OK (like 11 to 30).

Typically those less than stellar rankings are the result of intent mismatch. Creating new content will benefit from your existing topical authority and the new content will help boost that authority too.

Just make sure to link that content together using appropriate anchor text.

elements.text:
Stop thinking about individual pages and consider your site as a whole.

I would suggest creating supporting pages that address topics for which those powerful pages rank. Specifically topics where it wouldn’t fit well to update the existing page and yet your rank is OK (like 11 to 30).

Typically those less than stellar rankings are the result of intent mismatch. Creating new content will benefit from your existing topical authority and the new content will help boost that authority too.

Just make sure to link that content together using appropriate anchor text.

text: I hate to say it…but both. You likely want to keep these articles ranking. But writing new high ranking pieces on a related topic and interlinking will help too. If competitors for those keywords are writing more, and writing stronger pieces, you likely have to keep up somewhat with their volume and quality. (And the historical optimization of these pieces.)
